Description: 22533BRRequisition Number:Description:At Stantec, we approach every project as a partnership, because our work creates a lasting impact on our clients’ communities. We believe that when smart, passionate, creative people come together, real possibilities are within reach.Our people are at the heart of everything we do; they give our work purpose. If you want to be a part of our unwavering team and can bring your sense of imagination and determination to every challenge, then this is the right place for you.Stantec is currently looking for a Civil Engineer to work on projects associated with wet infrastructure, i.e. wastewater, stormwater, potable water and recycled water systems, water and wastewater treatment system, and flood management and water resources management studies.The role involves working on projects associated with wet infrastructure, i.e. wastewater, stormwater, potable water and recycled water systems, water and wastewater treatment system, and flood management and water resources management studies.This will involve undertaking field visits, investigations, data collection, planning, hydraulic modeling, master planning, design development, report writing, preparation of tender documents, technical specifications and BOQs.Key responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to:•\tReview, organize and analyze collected data•\tDevelop design briefs and Basis of Design technical notes•\tCarry out hydraulic modeling using recognized modeling software•\tPerform design calculations•\tDevelop design reports•\tDevelop and oversee design drawings•\tDevelop specifications and bill of quantities•\tDevelop cost estimates•\tWork in conjunction with peer engineers to overcome project design challenges•\tLiaise with other discipline teams and/or teams working remotely from other regions to facilitate completion of project tasks•\tLiaise with sub-consultants and sub-contractors to facilitate completion of project tasks•\tComplete all work in line with Stantec’s Core Values and in accordance with the Stantec’s Quality Systems, Project Quality procedures and Health & Safety procedures.•\tDesign for safety•\tOrganize and attend meetings with clients to collect data and discuss technical solutions and options•\tAttend meetings with stakeholders and follow up on NOCs for utility corridorsCompetencies:•\tGood level of client service management, i.e. able to interface with clients and build and maintain positive relationships with our clients•\tCapable to analyze, assess, evaluate issues, complexities pertaining to projects/work packages and support the team in mitigating them in advance•\tRigorous attention to detail, able to understand and adopt workflows and commitment to professional development•\tFlexible attitude to accepting different work assignments and proactive attitude to project execution and delivery•\tExperienced with wet infrastructure design standards in GCC Countries•\tExperienced with local and international guidelines/standards/codes and technical specifications for the design of wet infrastructure•\tAbility to work on bids to develop technical methodology and estimation of level of effort and identification of resources•\tInternational working experience, e.g. GCC Region, Europe, North America (preferred)•\tExcellent command in English both written and spoken•\tArabic language skills (preferred)•\tAbility to manage a heavy workload, with close attention to detail•\tAbility to make decisions independently and strong problem resolutions skills•\tStrong team working capabilities, committed to working with all levels of management on a daily and ongoing basis•\tProactive, working effectively in coordinating activities and complex tasks, taking professional responsibility and ownership•\tPunctual, attentive and competent in adhering to Stantec’s policies, procedures and work practicesTitle:Civil EngineerQualifications:•\tBachelor’s degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering from a recognized university•\t10+ years of experience in master planning and design of large scale wet infrastructure•\tWorking knowledge of engineering software such as AutoCAD, ArcGIS, InfoWater, InfoSewer, WaterGems, SewerGems, InfoWorks ICM, InfoWorks WS, etc.•\tProfessional accreditation (Chartership/PE or equivalent) from internationally recognised engineering institutions such as ICE, CIWEM, Engineer Australia, etc., or working towards itEmployment Type: Full-TimeJob Type: RegularJob Category: Civil EngineeringAbout Stantec:We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success.
